dmca.title: Second Notice of Abuse and Request to Cease and Desist
dmca.body:
T

________________________________

From: Mark Palmer [mailto:mark@jigsaw.com] 
Posted At: Tuesday, October 10, 2006 7:05 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Second Notice of Abuse and Request to Cease and Desist
Subject: Second Notice of Abuse and Request to Cease and Desist



Dear ThePlanet.com:

 

Thank you for your quick response. Jigsaw Data Corporation has made no
effort to "substantially comply with the required notification elements
of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA")" because the
abuse at issue is not being reported with respect to any copyright
claims at this time.  

 

For clarification, the jigsawdatacorporation.biz
<http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/>  domain, which ThePlanet.com
Internet Services, Inc. ('the Planet.com") is hosting at 67.18.160.230,
is falsely posing as Jigsaw Data Corporation, a Delaware corporation
with its principle offices in San Mateo, California.  

 

That imposter domain has been registered and is being used in bad faith.
The webpage found at www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz
<http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/>  uses Jigsaw Data Corporation's
trademark ("jigsaw" Reg. No.
<http://tess2.uspto.gov/bin/showfield?f=doc&state=6urlqn.2.11> 3057241)
and trade name repeatedly in the body of the page, and in its domain
name, to deliberately create confusion between
www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz <http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/>
and www.jigaw.com <http://www.jigaw.com/> . The domain name
www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz <http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/>
is itself confusingly similar to Jigsaw Data Corporation's trademark.
Further the page is falsely stating a direct relationship between SMS
Media Pvt. Ltd, an Indian entity, and Jigsaw Data Corporation, a
Delaware corporation, in an effort to defraud consumers in Indian and
elsewhere and to intentionally cause damage to Jigsaw Data Corporation. 

 

Additionally, it appears that www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz
<http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/> , hosted by the Planet.com, has
been designed and may be used to illegally capture Jigaw.com user names
and passwords (Phish) in an effort to facilitate unauthorized access to
Jigsaw.com, identity theft or to cause other damage.  Such conduct
potentially violates a wide variety of state and federal statutes, as
well as a number of common laws, regardless of any potential copyright
infringement.  

 

Our immediate intentions are follows: (i) to place the Planet on notice
of this continuing fraudulent and illegal conduct; (ii) to give the
Planet an opportunity to avoid continued involvement with same by
suspending hosting of the reported domain pending its internal
investigation; (iii) to mitigate potential damages to Jigsaw, our
members, and unsuspecting consumers in India and elsewhere; (iv) to
preserve evidence of any wrongdoing; and (v) to obtain appropriate
information, within your procedures, or as may be acquired pursuant to
law.  

 

I respectfully request that your legal counsel, Ms. Andrea Almeida, with
whom I spoke yesterday, contact me immediately and that the Planet.com
cease hosting the www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz
<http://www.jigsawdatacorporation.biz/>  site pending resolution of this
issue.  

 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation.

 

Regards,

 

Mark S. Palmer  

 

-------------------------------------------------------------

Mark S. Palmer

Corporate Counsel and Director of Privacy

Jigsaw Data Corporation

1700 S. Amphlett Blvd., Suite 250

San Mateo, CA 94402

mark@jigsaw.com

Tel: 650.655.2267

Fax: 650.655.2222

www.jigsaw.com <http://www.jigsaw.com/> 

 

 

________________________________

From: Copyright [mailto:Copyright@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 10, 2006 8:50 AM
To: mark@jigsaw.com
Cc: Theplanet@chillingeffects.org
Subject: FW: Notice of Abuse and Request to Cease and Desists

 

To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal
<http://www.theplanet.com/legal> .

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

 

 

________________________________

From: Mark Palmer [mailto:mark@jigsaw.com] 
Sent: Monday, October 09, 2006 5:21 PM
To: abuse
Cc: Andrea Almeida
Subject: Notice of Abuse and Request to Cease and Desists

Dear The Planet.com:

 

Please accept this as notice of abuse by the website that The Planet.com
hosts at jigsawdatacorporation.biz (67.18.160.230).

 

The jigsawdatacorporation.biz domain is owned by Archit Infotech, out of
Mumbai, India, whose actions, in association with those of SMS Media
Pvt. Ltd., are in violation of numerous intellectual property laws,
unfair trade practice regulations and miscellaneous other state and
Federal statutes.  Further, any implication of a relationship between
SMS Media and Jigsaw Data Company is fraudulent and deceitful.   

 

Jigsaw Data Corporation, a Delaware corporation, legitimately owes
operates a data company with an online marketplace at www.jigsaw.com
<http://www.jigsaw.com/> .   In order to prevent a continuing fraud and
to avoid other unnecessary damages, we respectfully request the
following:

 

1.       That The Planet immediately cease hosting
jigsawdatacorporation.biz pending your investigation;

2.       That The Planet collect and retain any and all information,
records and evidence in its possession custody or control with respect
to the hosting of jigsawdatacorporation.biz at 67.18.160.230.

3.       That The Planet (i) immediately state its policy and procedures
under which Jigsaw may request the information listed in (2.) above, and
(ii) if The Planet requires a subpoena or other court order for such
information, provide a timely response indicating the proper agent and
address for service of process and whether The Planet is will accept
service of our legal complaint as necessary to obtain such an order.

 

Please advise me of you intentions with respect to this matter at you
earliest convenience.  I look forward to hearing from you.  Thank you in
advance for your cooperation.

 

Mark S. Palmer

Corporate Counsel and Director of Privacy

Jigsaw Data Corporation

1700 S. Amphlett Blvd., Suite 250

San Mateo, CA 94402

mark@jigsaw.com

Tel: 650.655.2267

Fax: 650.655.2222

www.jigsaw.com <http://www.jigsaw.com/>
